name: Partner and Multi-Account: Manage Landing Pages
title: Partner and Multi-Account: Manage Landing Pages
body:
Go to the Phishing tab of your Account Management portal. Then, click the Landing Pages tab. From here you can view, edit, and categorize System Landing Pages and your own Managed Landing Pages. These landing pages will be available under Phishing > Landing Pages > Managed Landing Pages in each of your managed accounts.

If you've never created a landing page before, we recommend starting by editing one of our built-in landing pages. First, go to the System Landing Pages tab under Landing Pages. Then, click on the name of a landing page and use the editor to customize it to your liking. Once saved, this edited landing page will be added to your list of managed landing pages.

You can also create your own custom landing page from scratch by clicking the + Create Landing Page from the Managed Landing Pages tab under Landing Pages.

To access customized landing pages in your managed accounts, they must be added to a Managed Landing Page Category. You can categorize a landing page by clicking the checkbox next to the title, selecting a category from the options that appear at the top of the screen, and clicking Move. 

For more details about how to customize landing pages, see our How to Create and Edit Email Templates and Landing Pages article or watch our Customization of Phishing Templates and Landing Pages video.

Importing/exporting 

In addition to the Managed Landing Pages tab, you can export landing pages you've created and import them to specific managed accounts. You can use this functionality if you want to add certain landing pages to only specific accounts or if one of your accounts makes a landing page you'd like to use in other accounts. For more information on how to use this, check out our article Importing and Exporting Phishing Templates and Landing Pages

images.alt:
This technical description details the **Landing Pages** management interface of a web application.

**Header and Navigation:**
*   The primary page title is **Landing Pages**, accompanied by an icon resembling a target or compass.
*   A set of primary navigation tabs are present: **Campaigns**, **Email Templates**, and **Landing Pages**. The **Landing Pages** tab is currently active.
*   A secondary navigation segmented control features two tabs: **System Landing Pages** (active, gray background) and **Managed Landing Pages**.

**Sidebar (System Categories):**
*   The left panel is titled **System Categories**.
*   A list of categories is displayed, with associated counts in blue badges:
    *   **All Landing Pages** (Active, blue background, count: 7)
    *   **System Landing Pages** (Count: 3)
    *   **SEI Landing Page (Platinum/Diamond Only)** (Count: 1)
    *   **Generic** (Count: 2)
    *   **Phishing For Sensitive Information** (Count: 1)

**Main Content (All Landing Pages List):**
*   The right panel is titled **All Landing Pages**.
*   A search bar is located in the upper right, labeled "Search," with a magnifying glass icon for execution.
*   The content is presented in a sortable data table format with the following columns:
    1.  **Selection Checkbox** (Header contains a checkbox and a sort indicator).
    2.  **Title** (Sortable, indicated by "Title" text and a vertical double-arrow icon).
    3.  **Updated** (Sortable).
    4.  **URL** (Contains a hyperlink and a question mark icon for context/help).
    5.  **Actions** (Non-sortable).

**Data Table Rows (Sample Entries):**
The table displays seven entries. Key data points include:
*   **Title Examples:** "Basic 'Oops!' Landing Page," "Verify Java," "Generic Login Page," "404 Error Page."
*   **Updated Date:** All visible entries share the date **03/27/2020**.
*   **URL:** All visible URLs begin with `https://od-ryank-manag`.
*   **Actions:** Each row provides two primary actions, represented by teal icons: a **Copy** icon (stacked pages) and a **View/Preview** icon (an eye).
images.context: aved, this edited landing page will be added to your list of managed landing pages.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface for managing "Landing Pages" within a web application.

**Header and Primary Actions:**
The page title is "Landing Pages." A prominent blue button in the upper right corner is labeled "+ Create Landing Page."

**Navigation Structure:**
The interface uses hierarchical navigation tabs:
1.  **Primary Tabs:** "Campaigns," "Email Templates," and "Landing Pages" (currently selected).
2.  **Sub-Navigation Toggles:** "System Landing Pages" and "Managed Landing Pages" (currently active).

**Left Panel: Managed Categories:**
This panel lists categories under the heading "Managed Categories." An action button, "+ Add New Category," is present. The category list shows:
*   "All Landing Pages" (count: 2).
*   "Our Landing Pages" (currently selected, count: 2).

**Right Panel: Landing Page Data View:**
The view is titled "LP Mngd - 1." Actions for this section include a gray "Import" button (with a download icon) and a search bar labeled "Search."

The main content is a data table with the following sortable columns:
*   Checkbox (for selection)
*   Title
*   Updated (Date)
*   URL (includes a tooltip icon)
*   Actions

**Table Data:**
Two landing pages are listed, both updated on "04/02/2020":
1.  **Title:** Verify Java
2.  **Title:** 404 Error Page

Each row includes a truncated URL in a text field and two action icons under the "Actions" column: a Copy/Duplicate icon and a View/Eye icon.
images.context: trong> from the Managed Landing Pages tab under Landing Pages.

images.alt:
This image depicts the user interface for the **Landing Pages** management module.

**Header and Navigation:**
The primary navigation shows the **Landing Pages** tab selected, alongside non-selected tabs for **Campaigns** and **Email Templates**. A blue button labeled **+ Create Landing Page** is located in the top-right corner.

**Filtering and Segmentation:**
Below the main tabs, a segmented control is used for filtering content, with **Managed Landing Pages** selected over **System Landing Pages**.

**Left Pane (Managed Categories):**
The left panel manages categories and includes an **+ Add New Category** button. The navigation tree lists three categories:
1.  **All Landing Pages (2)**
2.  **Drafts (1)** (Currently selected, highlighted blue)
3.  **Our Landing Pages (2)**

**Right Pane (Content Table - Drafts):**
The main content area is titled **Drafts**. Control elements include a dark grey **Import** button and an adjacent **Search** bar. The content is displayed in a table format with sortable columns:

| Column Header | Details |
| :--- | :--- |
| Checkbox | For bulk selection. |
| **Title** | Sortable, lists the page name. Entry: "New Landing Page." |
| **Updated** | Sortable, lists the last modification date. Entry: "05/21/2020." |
| **URL** | Displays the page URL (partially visible). |
| **Actions** | Contains row-specific icons: A file/copy icon and an eye icon (view/preview). |

**Footer:**
The bottom of the screen contains standard links (**About**, **Helpdesk**) and copyright information: **© 2020 KnowBe4, Inc. All rights reserved.**
